name: 3dToutcount
author: AFNI Developers
description: Calculates the number of 'outliers' in a 3D+time dataset at each time point.

inputs.description: Prefix of the new dataset saved with the outlier Q values, applicable with the -save option
inputs.name: Output prefix

inputs.description: Only count voxels in the provided mask dataset
inputs.name: Mask dataset

inputs.description: Use 'q' instead of 0.001 in the calculation of alpha. Must be within range 0 < q < 1.
inputs.name: Q threshold

inputs.description: Clip off 'small' voxels (as in 3dClipLevel). Cannot use with -mask.
inputs.name: Autoclip flag

inputs.description: Automatically mask the dataset. Cannot use with -mask.
inputs.name: Automask flag

inputs.description: Output the fraction of (masked) voxels which are outliers at each time point, instead of the count.
inputs.name: Fraction flag

inputs.description: Print out median+3.5*MAD of outlier count with each time point.
inputs.name: Range flag

inputs.description: Detrend each voxel time series with polynomials of order 'nn'. Default value is 0, which removes the median.
inputs.name: Polort order

inputs.description: Use Legendre polynomials for detrending (also allows -polort > 3).
inputs.name: Legendre flag

output-files.description: Output dataset in AFNI format (HEAD file).
output-files.name: Output AFNI HEAD file

output-files.description: Output dataset in AFNI format (BRIK file).
output-files.name: Output AFNI BRIK file
